instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.R7020: What is R7020? Current sense shunt resistor for the charger, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 27/28 on ISL6259 should give you 20.02 ohms. .
definitions.R7051: What is R7051? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.R7050: What is R7050? Current sense shunt resistor for the battery, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 17/18 on ISL6259 should give you 2.02 ohms. .

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> up and down
threads.message:
Hello everybody

I m working on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not power up <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage is up to 14.4v 2 second later down 4.8V or 5V .

Magsafe green led is ok
PP3V42 is stable
Removed F7040 nothing changed
<RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR> voltage is 16.6V and stable
Replaced <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>,<TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR>,<TRANSISTOR>Q7035</TRANSISTOR> nothing changed
<SIGNAL>CHGR_UGATE</SIGNAL> voltage is up and down
When i measured <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> around resistors all is fine..
Also checked <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR>,21 and <RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR>,52 they are ok
When i injected 12.5V <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> fan spins,

What can i do next step?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> up and down
threads.message: Measure on pins 17/18 and 27/28 of <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>, corroded trace in the sense circuits are common.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> up and down
threads.message:
Duke problem fixed after when cable jump to 17/18 line to <RESISTOR>R7050</RESISTOR> ..

Thanks too much again
